description.narrative: NUTRITION: To detect and treat acute malnutrition in Abushok and As Salam campsNUTRITION: To prevent the deterioration of the nutritional status of the children under 3 in Abushok and As Salam IDP campsNUTRITION SURVEILLANCE: To assess and monitor the nutrition situation amongst the ACF-F target populations as well as the ones in need, and to analyse at central level the evolution of the nutrition situation throughout the country.FOOD SECURITY: To improve food intake through enhanced food production and optimization of food economy among at least 25,000 conflict-affected households (estimated 130,000 persons) in IDP camps and rural areas.PSYCHOSOCIAL: To strengthen nutrition care positive effects through adapted psychosocial support and mental health care to nutrition beneficiaries and their familiesPSYCHOSOCIAL: To identify mothers / families whose children are at-risk of malnutrition regarding psychosocial vulnerability and support them psychologically to emphasize positive care practices

owner-org.narrative: UK - Foreign, Commonwealth and Development Office (FCDO)

mailing-address.narrative: Public Enquiry Point, Abercrombie House, Eaglesham Road, East Kilbride, Glasgow G75 8EA
